intro: Kallias ovata, commonly known as the oval kallias, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with ovate leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, which are typical of its family. Kallias ovata thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
